Cryptocurrency: Another option would be to use cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin or Ethereum, to make purchases. These digital currencies can be stored on a computer or mobile device and used to make transactions online or in-person.

Bartering: Another way to pay for things would be to engage in bartering, where goods or services are exchanged for other goods or services. For example, someone might trade their skills as a carpenter for food or other necessities.

Digital Currency Wallets: A digital currency wallet is a software program that allows users to store, send, and receive digital currency. These wallets can be used to make purchases online or in-person, and can be stored on a computer or mobile device.

Prepaid Cards: Prepaid cards are similar to debit cards, but they are pre-loaded with a set amount of funds. These cards can be used to make purchases online or in-person, and can be stored in a wallet or purse.

Credit and Debit Cards: Credit and debit cards can still be used to make purchases, even if paper money and coins are no longer available. These cards are linked to a user's bank account and can be used to make purchases online or in-person.
